intro: Nototriche pulvilla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved nototriche, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters that attract various pollinators.
